Grouped_Utterances: Hi Ellie! I’ve been okay, just busy with work and waiting for my nursing license. It’s been alright. I still work at the retail store, but I’m finding it a bit exhausting. I guess I’m just worried about the future. I want to start my career as a nurse soon.
They’ve been really encouraging about my nursing career. They keep asking about my license.
Not really, but I feel like I’m on edge sometimes, and I don’t want to snap at anyone.
It felt nice to let go of the tension.
It’s tough. I feel tired a lot, and sometimes I don’t get enough sleep. I’ve tried to go to bed earlier, but it’s hard when I get home late.

That makes sense. Maybe we could explore some relaxation techniques that could help you unwind before bed? Great! One technique is progressive muscle relaxation. Have you heard of it before? It involves tensing and then relaxing different muscle groups in your body. This can help reduce tension and prepare you for sleep. Would you like to try it together? It’s important to remember that everyone has limits. Asking for support doesn’t mean you’re not capable. Would you like to role-play that conversation?

I think I can do that. I’ll try it tonight. Maybe I could take short breaks to breathe and calm down when I feel overwhelmed. I could start updating my resume and looking for job openings. Yes, I’ll aim to update my resume by the end of the week. Great! I’m looking forward to hearing how that goes. Let’s wrap up for today. Remember to practice the relaxation technique and consider having that conversation with your manager.
